settings.content: #1 Carry-On of 2025  →  See Why It Won

settings.text: The Best Carry-On Luggage of 2025 (After 20+ Flights Tested)

settings.content: We reviewed 5 of the top bags from TUMI, Away, Monos, and more. One stood out — not just for how it looks, but how it works.

settings.text_content:
At BestLuggage, we evaluate travel gear based on real-world performance,
not brand hype. 

We tested 8 of the most popular carry-ons from brands like TUMI, Away, Monos, and NOBL, focusing on what actually matters for frequent flyers: functionality, layout, handling, and long-term durability.

Every pick on this list is based on hands-on testing, industry expertise, and structured product comparison. 

Our team has reviewed over 200 travel products — and this guide reflects what we’d actually recommend to professionals who travel often and expect more from their gear.

settings.product_text_3:
Best overall carry-on:
NOBL Carry-On: All In One

Most stylish carry-on:
Away The Bigger Carry-On

Best light-weight carry-on:
TUMI 19 Degree Lite

settings.heading: What We Look for in Exceptional Carry-On Luggage
settings.feature_text_1:
Access That Works in Motion

The best carry-ons let you grab your laptop, charger, or passport without opening the whole case. Quick-access pockets and external ports make all the difference mid-transit.
settings.feature_text_2:
A Purposeful Interior Layout

Smart interior design isn’t about more space — it’s about better use of space. We looked for layouts that separate tech from clothing and make compression actually useful.
settings.feature_text_3:
Smooth Handling in Real Environments

A good suitcase should glide across airport tiles and rougher streets alike. Silent wheels, stable balance, and easy turns made a big difference in real-world testing.
settings.feature_text_4:
Durability That Justifies the Price

Whether it’s daily work trips or twice-a-year getaways, a premium carry-on should hold up. We prioritized strong shells, secure closures, and warranty-backed reliability.
settings.feature_text_5:
Professional Presence Without Flash

Style matters — but subtlety wins. The best bags looked sharp without trying too hard. Minimalist design and matte finishes tended to feel most elevated.
settings.feature_text_6:
Each of these bags has its strengths — from legacy craftsmanship to lightweight convenience — and all performed well in different scenarios. 

But only one model consistently stood out for professionals who travel often, expect efficiency, and demand real function from their gear. 

In the next section, we take a closer look at the carry-on that set a new benchmark in 2025: the NOBL Carry-On Pro.

settings.heading: Editor’s Pick – Best Overall Carry-On for 2025
settings.description:
One thing that stood out immediately: the latches.
In a category dominated by zippers, NOBL’s secure latch system felt cleaner, faster, and far more reliable — especially for protecting tech and essentials on the go.

settings.liked_list:
What We Loved:

  • Quick-access laptop pocket — no need to unzip the full case
  • Zipperless latch system with dual TSA-approved locks for added security
  • Modular compression layout that keeps tech, clothes, and chargers organized
  • Built-in USB-C passthrough and retractable cupholder
  • Smooth-rolling wheels and low-profile styling that fits in anywhere
settings.short_list:
Things to Consider:

  • Designed more for function than fashion — prioritizes utility
    over trend-forward extras.
settings.note:
Most bags get one thing right — this one got the important things. Fast laptop access, no zippers, real compression, and nothing extra.

Not the flashiest. Just the one we trusted every trip.

settings.description:
1. External Laptop Compartment

A rare but welcome feature — the padded laptop sleeve is accessible without opening the entire case. Ideal for security lines, lounges, or working on the go.

2. Structured, Modular Interior

Internal dividers and compression elements made it easy to keep clothes, chargers, documents, and toiletries separated

3. Professional Styling

Understated and clean. No oversized logos, trendy colorways, or gimmicks. This bag looks just as at home in an airport lounge as it does walking into a meeting.

4. Quiet Mobility

The wheels rolled quietly and smoothly over terminals, sidewalks, and cobblestones — no rattle, no drag, no wobble.

5. Materials That Last

From the aluminum latches to the reinforced shell and internal linings, every element of the NOBL felt intentionally overbuilt.

settings.Heading: Where It Excelled In Use
settings.bullets:
• Grab-and-go tech access during tight connections
  • Smart, stress-free packing for multi-day work trips
  • Fit into all overhead bins tested (including regional flights)
  • Looked polished without drawing attention
  • Easier to work out of while traveling — not just pack

settings.description:
“What immediately impressed me with the NOBL was the latch system. No jams, no stuck zippers, and it opens fast in tight spaces. That matters when you’re moving through 4 airports in a day.”

Captain M.D | Commercial Airline Pilot

settings.heading: TUMI 19 Degree Lite
settings.description: With its sleek polycarbonate shell and signature angled design, the TUMI 19 Degree Lite stands out for travelers who want to keep things light — without sacrificing quality.
settings.liked_list:
Things we liked:

  • Lightweight and easy to maneuver
  • Premium polycarbonate shell feels durable and refined
  • Sleek, sculpted design with a high-end finish
  • TSA-integrated lock and smooth wheels for seamless transit
settings.short_list:
Where it falls short:

  • No external laptop or tech compartment
  • Simplified interior layout — limited organization
  • Glossy shell may scuff with heavy use

settings.heading: Away The Carry-On
settings.description: The Away Carry-On has become a go-to for casual travelers thanks to its clean design, solid materials, and built-in charging capability. It looks great and performs well for occasional trips — but it lacks the technical features power travelers may need.
settings.liked_list:
Things we liked:

  • Sleek, minimalist styling that works in any setting
  • Lightweight and easy to lift overhead
  • Built-in ejectable battery (USB charging)
  • Durable polycarbonate shell holds up well for casual use
settings.short_list:
Where it falls short:

  • No exterior access — must fully open to reach anything
  • Basic interior layout with no compression or modular options
  • Prioritizes aesthetics over deep functionality

settings.heading: Monos Carry-On
settings.description: Monos is a solid option for style-conscious travelers who want simplicity and a cleaner look. It’s very similar to Away, though slightly heavier — and while it checks the basics, it didn’t offer much that set it apart in testing.
settings.liked_list:
Things we liked:

  • Clean, modern matte design
  • Quiet wheels and solid handling
  • Compression straps and a few helpful extras included
settings.short_list:
Where it falls short:

  • No tech compartment or quick-access pockets
  • A bit heavy for its size
  • Hard to justify the price over similarly styled options

settings.heading: Briggs & Riley Baseline Carry-On Spinner
settings.description: If you’re after durability above all else, this is your bag. But while it’s built to last a lifetime, the design, interior, and overall weight feel noticeably outdated in 2025.
settings.liked_list:
Things we liked:

  • Lifetime warranty - even covers airline damage
  • Strong frame and construction
  • Expandable for added  capacity
settings.short_list:
Where it falls short:

  • Heavy and bulky, even when empty
  • Interior layout is basic by today’s standards
  • Styling feels dated compared to modern competitors

settings.title:
Our Top Pick:
NOBL Carry-On: All In One
settings.description: The award winning ALL-IN-One Carry-On, designed to be more than a rolling box to store your things in.

• External Tech/ Laptop Access
  • Full Modular Interior / Compression System
  • Latch Closure (No Zippers)
  • Premium Build Quality

• External Tech/ Laptop Access
  • Full Modular Interior / Compression System
  • Latch Closure (No Zippers)
  • Premium Build Quality

• External Tech/Laptop Access
  • Full Modular Interior / Compression System
  • Latch Closure (No Zippers)
  • Premium Build Quality

• External Tech/ Laptop Access
  • Basic Interior (Simple straps)
  • Zippered Closure
  • Matte Finish, Smooth Glide

•  No Tech Access
  • Old-School Interior
  • Zippered Closure
  • Good Build Quality

settings.heading: Why the NOBL Carry-On Pro Came Out On Top
settings.subtext_1:
After side-by-side testing, NOBL didn’t just check more boxes — it solved more real problems.

Here’s how it compared to every other carry-on in the test:

settings.quote: I’ve seen every kind of carry-on come down a jet bridge. Lately? It’s always the NOBL. More and more crew are switching to it — and I get why. It’s sleek, secure, and actually functional.
As a consultant, I’m in and out of airports weekly. The NOBL is the first bag that’s kept up — no fumbling, no zippers failing, and it actually looks professional in a client meeting.
I work remote but travel often. The NOBL’s laptop access, cupholder, and layout make it feel like it was designed by someone who actually lives out of airports. Total game changer.

settings.heading: Trusted by People Who Actually Travel
settings.subtext_1:
The best feedback didn’t come from influencers — it came from the people who put carry-ons through real mileage.

Here’s what we heard again and again from those who live in airports, not Instagram feeds:

settings.title: Our Final Take: We Can Recommend NOBL Now — Without Hesitation
settings.description:
After hands-on testing, side-by-side comparisons, and feedback from people who live in airports, the verdict is clear:

NOBL isn’t just another carry-on. It’s the one we kept coming back to.

From pilots and consultants to remote workers and frequent flyers, it’s the only bag we tested that felt like it was built to solve real travel problems — not just check boxes on a spec sheet.

If you value function over flash, and you’re ready to stop compromising on your gear — this is the carry-on we’d recommend. Every time.
settings.subtext: The award winning All-in-One Carry-On, designed to be more than a rolling box to store your things in.
settings.warranty_text: NOBL covers functional repairs for life. Wheels, handles, latches, all protected.

settings.text: of testers said NOBL made airport security noticeably faster
preferred the latch system over traditional zippers after just one use
rated NOBL’s internal layout as more organized than their current carry-on

settings.question: Is the latch closure really better than zippers?
settings.answer: We didn’t expect this to matter as much as it did — but it does. The latches are faster, more secure, and don’t jam like zippers sometimes do. Especially useful in tight spaces or when moving quickly.

settings.question: How well does the interior actually work?
settings.answer: NOBL’s interior stood out for being more structured than most. The compression system is modular, not just straps — and the dividers help avoid that “everything dumped in one shell” feeling.

settings.question: Is it more durable than the big-name brands?
settings.answer: In our testing, it held up exceptionally well. Materials felt premium and sturdy — on par with (if not better than) higher-priced alternatives from legacy luggage brands.

settings.question: How does it compare to something like Away or Monos?
settings.answer: While Away and Monos are well-built, NOBL stood out for usability — the external tech access, structured interior, and silent wheels added real day-to-day benefits we didn’t get from others.

settings.question: Is this actually a good value?
settings.answer: Compared to other bags with fewer features, it held up better, felt more premium, and came backed by a lifetime warranty — without costing more.

settings.question: Who would get the most out of this?
settings.answer: People who travel often and want gear that keeps pace — consultants, remote workers, airline crew. It’s a bag built for movement, not just minimalism.

settings.title: Key Questions We Asked (and Answered) About NOBL
BestLuggage
settings.desv:
Every bag featured here was evaluated hands-on, with feedback from frequent flyers, business travelers, and airline crew.

No paid placements. No fluff. Just gear we’d actually recommend — and trust with our own trips.
